dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4245 IH: Enforce the Caps Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Grothman (for himself, Mr. Babin, Mr. Barr, Mr. Good of Virginia, Ms. Greene of Georgia, Mr. Harris, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. LaMalfa, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Norman, Mr. Rouzer, and Mr. Santos) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Budget

form.official-title: To amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to provide for discretionary spending limits for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2029, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enforce the Caps Act.

section.header: Discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 2026 through 2029
section.text: Section 251(c) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 901(c)), as amended by the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023, is further amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (9)(B), by striking and at the end; and
by inserting after paragraph (10) the following:
for fiscal year 2026, for the discretionary category, $1,621,959,000,000 in new budget authority;
for fiscal year 2027, for the discretionary category, $1,638,179,000,000 in new budget authority;
for fiscal year 2028, for the discretionary category, $1,654,560,000,000 in new budget authority; and
for fiscal year 2029, for the discretionary category, $1,671,106,000,000 in new budget authority;
